1.name: The Godfather: Part II
1.description: The early life and career of Vito Corleone in 1920s New York City is portrayed, while his son, Michael, expands and tightens his grip on the family crime syndicate.

2.name: Chinatown
2.description: A private detective hired to expose an adulterer finds himself caught up in a web of deceit, corruption, and murder.

3.name: Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore
3.description: A recently widowed woman is on the road with her precocious young son, determined to make a new life for herself as a singer.

4.name: The Texas Chain Saw Massacre
4.description: Two siblings and three of their friends en route to visit their grandfather's grave in Texas end up falling victim to a family of cannibalistic psychopaths and must survive the terrors of Leatherface and his family.

5.name: Blazing Saddles
5.description: In order to ruin a western town, a corrupt politician appoints a black Sheriff, who promptly becomes his most formidable adversary.

6.name: Murder on the Orient Express
6.description: In December 1935, when his train is stopped by deep snow, detective Hercule Poirot is called on to solve a murder that occurred in his car the night before.

7.name: Young Frankenstein
7.description: An American grandson of the infamous scientist, struggling to prove that his grandfather was not as insane as people believe, is invited to Transylvania, where he discovers the process that reanimates a dead body.

8.name: The Towering Inferno
8.description: At the opening party of a colossal, but poorly constructed, office building, a massive fire breaks out that threatens to destroy the tower and everyone in it.

9.name: Death Wish
9.description: A New York City architect becomes a one-man vigilante squad after his wife is murdered by street punks in which he randomly goes out and kills would-be muggers on the mean streets after dark.

10.name: The Man with the Golden Gun
10.description: James Bond is targeted by the world's most expensive assassin, while he attempts to recover sensitive solar cell technology that is being sold to the highest bidder.

11.name: Zardoz
11.description: In the distant future, a savage trained only to kill finds a way into the community of bored immortals that alone preserves humanity's achievements.

12.name: The Great Gatsby
12.description: A Midwesterner becomes fascinated with his nouveau riche neighbor, who obsesses over his lost love.

13.name: The Conversation
13.description: A paranoid, secretive surveillance expert has a crisis of conscience when he suspects that a couple, on whom he is spying, will be murdered.

14.name: The Longest Yard
14.description: A sadistic warden asks a former pro quarterback, now serving time in his prison, to put together a team of inmates to take on (and get pummeled by) the guards.

15.name: Les valseuses
15.description: Two whimsical, aimless thugs harass and assault women, steal, murder, and alternately charm, fight, or sprint their way out of trouble. They take whatever the bourgeois characters value: ...                See full summary »

16.name: A Woman Under the Influence
16.description: Mabel, a wife and mother, is loved by her husband Nick but her mental illness proves to be a problem in the marriage.

17.name: Il portiere di notte
17.description: After a chance meeting at a hotel in 1957, Holocaust survivor Lucia and Nazi officer Max, who tortured her, resume their sadomasochistic relationship.

18.name: Flesh Gordon
18.description: Emperor Wang is leader of the planet Porno and sends his mighty "Sex Ray" towards Earth, turning everyone into sex-mad fiends. Only one man can save the Earth, football player Flesh Gordon

19.name: Black Christmas
19.description: During their Christmas break, a group of sorority girls are stalked by a stranger.

20.name: Foxy Brown
20.description: A voluptuous black vigilante takes a job as a high-class prostitute in order to get revenge on the mobsters who murdered her boyfriend.

21.name: Earthquake
21.description: Various interconnected people struggle to survive when an earthquake of unimaginable magnitude hits Los Angeles, California.

22.name: Captain Kronos: Vampire Hunter
22.description: A master swordsman and former soldier and his hunchbacked assistant hunt vampires.

23.name: Phantom of the Paradise
23.description: A disfigured composer sells his soul for the woman he loves so that she will perform his music. However, an evil record tycoon betrays him and steals his music to open his rock palace, The Paradise.

24.name: The Arena
24.description: In ancient Rome audiences have grown tired of viewing gladiators fight to the death. Something new is needed--women. (Josiah Howard, "Blaxploitation cinema: The Essential Reference Guide.")

25.name: Thunderbolt and Lightfoot
25.description: With the help of an irreverent young sidekick, a bank robber gets his old gang back together to organize a daring new heist.

26.name: Airport 1975
26.description: A 747 in flight collides with a small plane, and is rendered pilotless. Somehow the control tower must get a pilot aboard so the jet can land.

27.name: Mr. Majestyk
27.description: A melon farmer battles organized crime and a hit man who wants to kill him.

28.name: Dark Star
28.description: In the far reaches of space, a small crew, 20 years into their solitary mission, find things beginning to go hilariously wrong.

29.name: The Sugarland Express
29.description: A woman attempts to reunite her family by helping her husband escape prison and together kidnapping their son. But things don't go as planned when they are forced to take a police hostage on the road.

30.name: Lenny
30.description: The story of acerbic 1960s comic Lenny Bruce, whose groundbreaking, no-holds-barred style and social commentary was often deemed by the Establishment as too obscene for the public.

31.name: Emmanuelle
31.description: The wife of a French diplomat in Bangkok, Emmanuelle embarks on a voyage of sexual discovery.

32.name: The Taking of Pelham One Two Three
32.description: In New York, armed men hijack a subway car and demand a ransom for the passengers. Even if it's paid, how could they get away?

33.name: The Parallax View
33.description: An ambitious reporter gets in way-over-his-head trouble while investigating a senator's assassination which leads to a vast conspiracy involving a multinational corporation behind every event in the world's headlines.

34.name: The Front Page
34.description: As a tabloid newspaper editor tries to prevent his top reporter from retiring, an escaped death row convict shows up at the office trying to convey his innocence.

35.name: Vampyres
35.description: Two mysterious women lure various passers-by to their rural mansion in the English countryside and hold them captive in order to feed on them to satisfy their insatiable thirst for blood.

36.name: It's Alive
36.description: The Davies expect a baby, which turns out to be a monster with a nasty habit of killing when it's scared. And it's easily scared.

37.name: The Land That Time Forgot
37.description: During World War I, a German U-boat sinks a British ship and takes the survivors on board. After it takes a wrong turn, the submarine takes them to the unknown land of Caprona, where they find dinosaurs and neanderthals.

38.name: Il fiore delle mille e una notte
38.description: Ancient Arabia. A youth is chosen by a beautiful slave girl to be her new master; she is kidnapped and they must search for each other. Stories are told within stories; love, travel and the whims of destiny.

39.name: Uptown Saturday Night
39.description: At Madame Zenobia's illegal nightclub, when Steve Jackson and Wardell Franklin get robbed of their wallets containing a winning lottery ticket, they set out to recover it.

40.name: Scener ur ett äktenskap
40.description: Scenes from a Marriage chronicles the many years of love and turmoil that bind Marianne (Liv Ullmann) and Johan (Erland Josephson) through matrimony, infidelity, divorce, and subsequent partners.

41.name: The Yakuza
41.description: American private-eye Harry Kilmer returns to Japan to rescue a friend's kidnapped daughter from the clutches of the Yakuza.

42.name: Deranged
42.description: A deranged rural farmer becomes a grave robber and murderer after the death of his possessive mother, whose corpse he keeps, among others, as his companion in a decaying farmhouse.

43.name: Big Bad Mama
43.description: Mama and daughters get forced by circumstances into bootlegging and bank robbing, and travel across the country trailed by the law.

44.name: Travolti da un insolito destino nell'azzurro mare d'agosto
44.description: A trip into the Mediterranean sea becomes a trip into the discovery of how society's frameworks of the rich and poor are delicate and temporary.

45.name: Bring Me the Head of Alfredo Garcia
45.description: An American bar room pianist and his prostitute girlfriend go on a trip through the Mexican underworld to collect a bounty on the head of a dead gigolo.

46.name: Where the Red Fern Grows
46.description: Where the Red Fern Grows is the heartwarming and adventurous tale for all ages about a young boy and his quest for his own red-bone hound hunting dogs.

47.name: Phase IV
47.description: Desert ants suddenly form a collective intelligence and begin to wage war on the inhabitants. It is up to two scientists and a stray girl they rescue from the ants to destroy them.

48.name: Female Trouble
48.description: A spoiled schoolgirl runs away from home, gets pregnant while hitch-hiking, and ends up as a fashion model for a pair of beauticians who like to photograph women committing crimes.

49.name: The Lords of Flatbush
49.description: A group of kids in Brooklyn form a gang. From this moment on they do everything together. This makes things easier but at the same time they have to face new problems.

50.name: Angst essen Seele auf
50.description: An almost accidental romance is kindled between a German woman in her mid-sixties and a Moroccan migrant worker around twenty-five years younger. They abruptly decide to marry, appalling everyone around them.
